page.title: 09Transport on Lundy.
page.content: There are no real roads on Lundy. Besides the main N/W. track there is a track which goes down to the Landing Beach where supplies are picked up. Because of the lack of roads,and the fact that virtually everyone lives in the village,cars are unnecessary.There are 4 tractors.(One of them is always used on the beach to launch and land the cobble, and to unload supplies from the landing craft).The 3 Big Reds (Honda trikes)are used for tasks like carrying luggage to and from the helicopter.The Land Rover is used for emergencies,accidents and rough ground. We saw a lady who had cut her leg and she was picked up by the Land Rover before being flown by helicopter to hospital.The bulldozer,besides earth-moving,is sometimes used for snow clearance in the winter-but snow is rare.{J.Perryman and M.Glastonbury.
